features.feature_desc: Add any number of widgets. E.g., Create separate widgets for desktop and mobile, or show different widgets for different countries or different pages
Choose any social channel e.g., Facebook/Messenger/WhatsApp/Instagram & more
Add a contact form to your Chaty widget. Using the contact form you can collect info like the name, email, phone, and a message from your website's visitors
Change colors, button placement, custom icon, fonts, & more to match your brand identity
Change each channel's color (or use an image for a channel), device visibility (phone/desktop), hover text & more
Trigger the widget on exit intent, after a certain time period, or when user scrolls to a specific part of the website
Grab users' attention with fancy effects
Show widget on specific pages on a website, or even exclude on some of the pages. Use RegEx like conditions such as contains, exact match, starts with, and ends with
Add custom channels along with default channels. For example, you can add your personal website as a new custom channels
Show the widget only to visitors who come from specific traffic sources, including direct traffic, social networks, search engines, Google Ads, or any other traffic source
Choose between two types of pop-up designs, set pop-up text and color, and use merge tags like the URL and title. Customize the behavior of the widget based on visitor interaction.
Show multiple agents under a single channel. For example, allow visitors to reach for pre-sales info or support with different channels on WhatsApp
Get your contact forms leads' details directly to your email
Show the widget for specific countries
Display the widget on specific dates as you prefer. I.e., Show a widget specifically when you launch a marketing campaign
Display the widget on specific days & hours. I.e., show the widget on your working hours Monday-Thursday, 09:00 to 17:00
Add your own pre-set message that's automatically added to the user's message when they click WhatsApp. E.g., you can get the Page title & URL when someone sends you a message from that page
Track which channels are getting the most clicks with GA events
